definition: lit. a wise person reflecting a thousand times can still make a mistake (idiom); fig. nobody is infallible
pinyin: zhi4 zhe3 qian1 lu:4 , bi4 you3 yi1 shi1

definition: wisdom/knowledge

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this
see 鞦韆|秋千[qiu1 qian1]
thousand
to think over/to consider/anxiety
certainly/must/will/necessarily
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to lose/to miss/to fail
even the wisest can have a momentary lapse in judgment (idiom)/every man has a fool in his sleeve
pinyin: cong1 ming5 yi1 shi4 , hu2 tu5 yi1 shi2

definition: planning is with man, accomplishing with heaven (idiom); Man proposes but God disposes.
pinyin: mou2 shi4 zai4 ren2 , cheng2 shi4 zai4 tian1

definition: a clever person may become the victim of his own ingenuity (idiom); cleverness may overreach itself/too smart for one's own good
pinyin: cong1 ming2 fan3 bei4 cong1 ming2 wu4

definition: there can never be too much deception in war/in war nothing is too deceitful/all's fair in war
lit. easy to dodge the spear in the open, hard to avoid a stab in the dark (idiom); it is hard to guard against secret conspiracies
pinyin: ming2 qiang1 yi4 duo3 , an4 jian4 nan2 fang2

definition: How do you catch the tiger cub without entering the tiger's lair? (idiom); Nothing ventured, nothing gained.
pinyin: bu4 ru4 hu3 xue2 , yan1 de2 hu3 zi3

definition: God's plans supersede our own/Man proposes but God disposes
pinyin: ren2 suan4 bu4 ru2 tian1 suan4

definition: lit. a crafty rabbit has three burrows/a sly individual has more than one plan to fall back on (idiom)
lit. an arrogant army is bound to lose (idiom)/fig. pride goes before a fall
to prophesy with supernatural accuracy (idiom)/to have an incredible foresight
to lose at sunrise but gain at sunset (idiom)/to compensate later for one's earlier loss/what you lose on the swings you gain on the roundabouts
pinyin: shi1 zhi1 dong1 yu2 , shou1 zhi1 sang1 yu2

definition: the mantis stalks the cicada, unaware of the oriole behind (idiom, from Daoist classic Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子); to pursue a narrow gain while neglecting a greater danger
pinyin: tang2 lang2 bu3 chan2 , huang2 que4 zai4 hou4

definition: the old man lost his mare, but it all turned out for the best (idiom); fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
pinyin: sai4 weng1 shi1 ma3 yan1 zhi1 fei1 fu2

definition: lit. the birds are over, the bow is put away (idiom); fig. to get rid of sb once he has served his purpose
lit. for some things a foot may be too short, and for the other an inch will suffice (proverb)/fig. everyone has their strong and weak points/everything has its advantages and disadvantages
pinyin: chi3 you3 suo3 duan3 , cun4 you3 suo3 chang2

definition: an outsider can see things more clearly or objectively than those involved (idiom)
pinyin: dang1 ju2 zhe3 mi2 , pang2 guan1 zhe3 qing1
